result.execSummary:
The defendant James Robert Anderson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery by Prisoners, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.20(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Case called 1:43 pm.  Defendant James Robert Anderson in court, in custody with attorney Robert W Buckett.  James T Sempf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews Plea agreement with DE, repeater enhancer will be dropped.  DE pleads NC to Count 1, with NO repeater enhancer.  Court reviews the PQWOR with DE.  Court finds plea made FVI, finds factual basis, accepts plea and finds guilty of battery by prisoner without repeater.  Atty. Sempf is heard on recommendation.  Atty. Buckett responds.  Mr. Anderson makes statement.  Court is heard and sentence imposed:

54 Months DOC, consecutive to any other sentence:
24 Months IC,
30 Months ES.
Costs. 
DNA sample.
